name: Spinosaurus aegyptiacus
description: A semi-aquatic theropod with distinctive sail-like neural spines, Spinosaurus is believed to have hunted both aquatic and terrestrial prey.

name: Giganotosaurus carolinii
description: A massive theropod from South America, rivaling Tyrannosaurus rex in size, known for its speed and long, serrated teeth.

name: Carcharodontosaurus saharicus
description: A North African giant theropod with blade-like teeth, earning its name 'shark-toothed lizard'.

name: Acrocanthosaurus atokensis
description: A large theropod from North America, recognizable by its high neural spines along the back and shoulders.

name: Tyrannosaurus rex
description: One of the largest land predators, famed for its massive skull, powerful bite force, and relatively small arms.
